articles.author: Meghan Bartels
articles.title: The first solar eclipse of 2022 has begun and here's the view! - Space.com
articles.description: Live broadcasts bring the eclipse from South America worldwide.
articles.content:
It's the moment skywatchers have been waiting for: The year's first solar eclipse has begun.
The partial solar eclipse of April 30 began at about 2:45 p.m. EDT (1845 GMT), according to Timeanddate.c… [+2143 chars]

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Angelina Jolie visits Ukraine, meeting children and volunteers affected by Russia's invasion - ABC News
articles.description: American actor, filmmaker, and humanitarian Angelina Jolie has visited the Ukrainian city of Lviv, going to the railway station to meet some of the people displaced by the war with Russia.

articles.author: Zoe Sottile, CNN
articles.title: Don't look up: 2022's first solar eclipse will appear in the southern hemisphere today - CNN
articles.description: Today, people in some parts of southern South America, Antarctica, and the Pacific and Southern Oceans will be able to watch the first solar eclipse of the year.
articles.content:
(CNN)Today, people in some parts of southern South America, Antarctica, and the Pacific and Southern Oceans will be able to watch the first solar eclipse of the year.

articles.title: CSIS flags issues with U.S. intelligence prior to Jan. 6 riot, says it faces the same problems - CBC News
articles.description: American intelligence agencies struggled with "inconsistencies" in their analysis and "a lack of consensus" on the nature of the threat in the weeks prior to the Jan. 6, 2021 riot on Capitol Hill, says an internal Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS)…
